description.narrative:
Overall and specific objectives of the project
The new Program aims to increase incomes, job quality, and job security for urban female and male youth. It will be implemented in two defined urban areas, Monrovia (Montserrado County) and Ganta (Nimba County), with potential expansion to secondary locations and counties contingent on the results of the first years Inception Phase activities. It will be one of the first Market Systems Development (MSD) programs focused on urban youth employment in Liberia, and will also provide new insights for the Swedish Embassy and the development sector in general around the MSD approach in the Liberian context, that could be considered to be thin and fragile. The program will also be looking at the connections between primary and secondary urban areas. The program will start with an inception phase to validate the initial assumptions and underlying problems.
There are three outcomes:
Enhanced job-readiness of young men and women.
Increased female and male-owned micro-enterprises access to markets and market services.
Growth in respondible and inclusive labor-intensive businesses.

Programmet Promoting Sustainable Partnerships for Economic Transformation (PROSPECTS) IV är på 45 månader och syftar till att påverka fattigdom genom att öka inkomsterna, arbetskvaliteten och jobbsäkerheten för 16 400 stadsungdomar. Programmet kommer att genomföras i Montserrado och Nimba län, med potentiell expansion till andra län beroende på första årets startaktiviteter. En föreslagen budget på 48 000 000 SEK presenteras. UTSIKTER IV bygger på tidigare Sveriges regeringens investeringar genom UTSIKTER I - III, men går bort från modellen för direkt leverans till att underlätta systemförändringar genom att tillämpa ett marknadsutvecklingsbaserat tillvägagångssätt för att skapa anständiga och produktiva arbetstillfällen.

The Promoting Sustainable Partnerships for Economic Transformation (PROSPECTS) IV Program is for 45 months, and aims to impact poverty by increasing incomes, job quality and job security for 16,400 urban youth. The program will be implemented in Montserrado and Nimba counties, with potential expansion to other counties contingent on first year’s inception activities. A proposed budget of 48,000,000 SEK is presented. PROSPECTS IV builds on previous Government of Sweden investments through PROSPECTS I – III, but moves away from direct delivery model to facilitating systemic change through application of a Market Systems Development based approach to creating decent and productive employment.

tag.narrative: 8.5 - By 2030, achieve full and productive employment and decent work for all women and men, including for young people and persons with disabilities, and equal pay for work of equal value.

8.5 - Senast 2030 uppnå full och produktiv sysselsättning med anständiga arbetsvillkor för alla kvinnor och män, inklusive ungdomar och personer med funktionsnedsättning, samt lika lön för likvärdigt arbete.
